course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Gender and Development
course.description: This course will help students to develop an understanding of the interactions between gender and development, through an analysis of theoretical frameworks as well as a discussion of case studies from developing countries. It will study the impact of various development interventions and policies targeted at women - such as micro-credit, conditional cash transfers and reproductive policies.

reviews.author: ykl
reviews.title: BAD GRADE
reviews.comment_content: Altho it is a sosc course but you would probs do better if you are a busi student
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is nice and helpful. However, the lecture materials always seem a bit irrelevant to the readings and the discussion. The discussion is largely based on the readings and has nothing to do with the lectures.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 group presentations on reading
1 group project (presentation + ~4000 words essay)
1 individual research paper (3500 words)
Discussion in every class

Very chur, has to speak a lot in class to get good impression and choose groupmates carefully or gg
